channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Inside Man City's rebuild and plan for life without Guardiola
item.description: BBC Sport looks at Manchester City's evolution and why the January window has offered renewed belief.

item.title: 'Years in the making' - are Arsenal ready to shed 'nearly-men' tag?
item.description: Arsenal have moved a step closer to winning their first major silverware since 2020 by beating Chelsea 4-2 on aggregate in the Carabao Cup semi-final.

item.title: The F1, football and NFL figures who kept Epstein links after conviction
item.description: Senior figures in sport maintained personal contact with Jeffrey Epstein, while others were discussed regarding potential deals.

item.title: Aberdeen v Celtic & Dundee v Motherwell games off
item.description: Celtic's Scottish Premiership visit to Aberdeen is postponed, along with Dundee's match with Motherwell, after heavy rain in the north east.

item.title: Is Guardiola right about Man City's lower net spend?
item.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola said his team only sit seventh on net spend over the last five years. Is he right?

item.title: The goalscoring Spurs defender making headlines in Germany
item.description: Luka Vuskovic has earned a reputation for scoring goals on loan at Hamburg, but just how good is the teenage Tottenham defender?

item.title: 'He's better than that' - Wilson joining Spurs a bad decision, says McInnes
item.description: Hearts manager Derek McInnes believes teenage striker James Wilson has made a mistake by joining Tottenham on loan.

item.title: Chelsea adopt Match of the Day tactic to stop Arsenal set-piece threat
item.description: Despite losing their Carabao Cup semi-final, Chelsea attempted a new way of stopping Arsenal set-pieces - just days after a similar suggestion on Match of the Day.

item.title: Kante joins Fenerbahce after deal revival
item.description: N'Golo Kante joins Fenerbahce from Al-Ittihad after issues over documentation appeared to threaten deal.

item.title: Scottish Premiership preview - Aberdeen v Celtic, Naderi & Bartley in focus
item.description: Aberdeen v Celtic, Rangers' new striker Ryan Naderi and Livingston manager Marvin Bartley headline our Premiership preview.

item.title: Everton sack Sorensen days after first home WSL win of season
item.description: Brian Sorensen, who took charge in 2022, is sacked with Everton fourth from bottom of the Women's Super League.

item.title: Why time is running out for Milan's iconic San Siro
item.description: BBC Sport visits the San Siro in Milan, the venue for the Winter Olympics opening ceremony, to find out why this could be the last global event held at the iconic stadium, and what comes next.

item.title: 'Playing with fire' catches up with 10-man Hearts - McInnes
item.description: Head coach Derek McInnes concedes that Premiership leaders Hearts were punished for "playing with fire" as a third red card in five matches contributes to a 1-0 defeat at St Mirren.

item.title: Can you name the line-ups from Newcastle's last away win at Man City?
item.description: Newcastle must end an 11-game winless run at Manchester City to have any chance of reaching the Carabao Cup final.

item.title: 'It hurts me' - Guardiola vows to speak up on conflicts
item.description: Pep Guardiola has spoken passionately about children being killed and injured in conflict zones across the world, saying the footage he sees "hurts me".

item.title: FAI progress Women's Champions League final bid
item.description: The Football Association of Ireland submits a preliminary bid to host the Women's Champions League final at the Aviva Stadium in Dublin in 2029.

item.title: Testing protocol for prostate cancer 'alarming' - Hislop
item.description: Shaka Hislop says it is "alarming" that tests for prostate cancer are not "regular and "standardised" in the United Kingdom.

item.title: Carroll denies breach of non-molestation order in court
item.description: The ex-England striker denies breaching a non-molestation order against Towie star Billi Mucklow.

item.title: How can Man City get Haaland firing again?
item.description: BBC Sport's football tactics correspondent Umir Irfan analyses why Manchester City striker Erling Haaland has stopped scoring in the Premier League and looks at ways Pep Guardiola can get the centre-forward scoring regularly again.

item.title: 206 goals for Newcastle - but which were Shearer's best?
item.description:
It's 20 years to the day since Alan Shearer became Newcastle United's all-time leading goalscorer, with his 201st strike in black and white.
But which of his 206 Toon goals stand out? Alan picked his favourites earlier this season on Football Focus, live from St James' Park.

item.title: Talbi rocket seals decisive Sunderland win over Burnley
item.description: Watch highlights as Sunderland earn a decisive victory over struggling Burnley, capped by an incredible long-range goal from Chemsdine Talbi.

item.title: 'Stronger, quicker, better, smarter than everyone'
item.description: Rory Smith and Chris Sutton analyse Arsenal’s dominant 4-0 win over Leeds United, explaining why the Gunners look destined for Premier League glory.

item.title: 'Unacceptable' - Parker fumes at passive Burnley side
item.description: Scott Parker believes his Burnley "never gave themselves a chance" against Sunderland, as the side failed to manage a shot on target during the game.

item.title: The talented playmaker no-one seems to want
item.description: Harvey Elliott is one of England's most gifted young players - but neither Aston Villa or Liverpool appear to rate the midfielder.

item.title: Who won the WSL transfer window? Rate each club's deals
item.description: BBC Sport pundits Steph Houghton, Ellen White, Karen Bardsley and Jen Beattie rate each WSL club's transfer window - and you can too.

item.title: Liverpool to rival Man Utd for Wharton - Wednesday's gossip
item.description: Liverpool, Manchester United and Real Madrid eye Adam Wharton deal, Manchester United could move for Jean-Philippe Mateta and Sandro Tonali, Leeds keeper Illan Meslier looks to be heading to Turkey.

item.title: Fishlock has 'had conversations' over Wales role
item.description: Jess Fishlock says she is "fleshing out the details" over a potential role with Wales following her retirement from international football.

item.title: Solanke scorpion kick helps Spurs fight back against Man City
item.description: Dominic Solanke scores twice, including a spectacular scorpion kick, as Tottenham come from behind to draw against Manchester City with a rousing second-half performance.

item.title: Sesko scores dramatic late winner as Man Utd beat Fulham
item.description: Manchester United avoided Fulham's late comeback due to a Benjamin Sesko goal in stoppage time to give United three points and continue head coach Michael Carrick's perfect start.

item.title: 10-man Brentford hold on for hard-fought win at Villa
item.description: Brentford hold on to an important win against Aston Villa, despite Kevin Schade's sending off during the first half.

item.title: Has the January transfer window always felt flat?
item.description: With just seven Premier League deals done on transfer deadline day, has the winter transfer window become a damp squib?

item.title: 'Women's FA Cup revamp would ruin the magic'
item.description: Several official supporters' clubs have hit out at a proposed new format for the Women's FA Cup, stating the changes will ruin the "magic" of the competition and mean the "rich will only get richer".

item.title: Just seven signings - the Premier League's quiet deadline day
item.description: A low-key transfer deadline day ended with the fewest Premier League deals completed in a winter window. BBC Sport looks at the spending that was done, and examines why there was so little activity.

item.title: Celtic's O'Neill 'very interested' in Oxlade-Chamberlain
item.description: Celtic manager Martin O'Neill says he would be "very interested" in signing free agent Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain, but reckons the former Liverpool and Arsenal midfielder has lots of options.

item.title: Championship transfer window winners and losers
item.description: BBC Sport looks at the teams who have emerged from the winter window looking stronger and those with question marks over the likely direction of their season.

item.title: Palace criticised for 'messing' with McNeil mental health
item.description: Dwight McNeil's partner criticises Crystal Palace for "messing" with his mental health after the collapse of his transfer from Everton.

item.title: Tonali 'very happy' at Newcastle amid Arsenal links
item.description: Manager Eddie Howe says Sandro Tonali is "very happy" at Newcastle United after the midfielder was linked with a move to Arsenal.

item.title: Infantino 'infantile' for wanting to lift Russia ban
item.description: Ukraine's sports minister calls Fifa president Gianni Infantino "irresponsible" and "infantile" for saying it will look at lifting a ban on Russia.

item.title: London City Lionesses sign midfielder Marcetto until 2028
item.description: London City Lionesses sign Denmark midfielder Malou Marcetto on a permanent deal from Madrid CFF.

item.title: Sheff Wed have finances to get through season
item.description: Sheffield Wednesday's administrators say the club has enough money to get through to the end of the season.

item.title: West Ham sell Denton for club record fee to Bay FC
item.description: West Ham sell defender Anouk Denton for a club record fee of £200,000 to American side Bay FC.

item.title: 'Things happened quickly' - Bartley on Livi job
item.description: New Livingston manager Marvin Bartley only found out on Sunday morning he would be replacing David Martindale, hours before the club announced the change.

item.title: Adamu, Arthur & Mvuka join Celtic on loan
item.description: Celtic have signed Austria striker Junior Adamu from Bundesliga club Freiburg, Brentford centre-half Benjamin Arthur and Lorient winger Joel Mvuka, all on loan to the end of the season.

item.title: Le Bris calms Europe talk as '40 points the target'
item.description: Sunderland manager Regis Le Bris says he is primarily focused on achieving Premier League safety, despite a 3-0 win over Burnley propelling his side to eighth in the table.

item.title: Will Man Utd miss Casemiro?
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Troy Deeney discuss whether Manchester United will miss the departing Casemiro's intelligence and calmness, after he inspired the Red Devils' to a 3-2 win over Fulham.

item.title: 'The front three are frightening' - how Man City punished Chelsea
item.description: Women's Football Show pundits Natasha Dowie and Fern Whelan analyse Manchester City's "ruthless" 5-1 display over Chelsea in the Women's Super League.

item.title: 'Pass forward, run forward' - Spurs' superb second half
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Troy Deeney analyse how Spurs mounted a superb second-half comeback in their 2-2 draw against Manchester City.

item.title: Naalsund scores two against Liverpool as Man Utd go second
item.description: A brace from Lisa Naasland helped Manchester United beat Liverpool, moving them up to second in the WSL.

item.title: 'Strong and smart' - Liverpool's £60m man, who can 'become like Van Dijk'
item.description: Jeremy Jacquet will join Liverpool for £60m from Rennes in the summer - but why are the Reds signing him?

item.title: All the done deals on deadline day in one place
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Booed by some, loved by others - why does Vinicius divide Real fans?
item.description: Despite scoring a vital goal against Rayo Vallecano, why does forward Vinicius Jr continue to split opinion at the Bernabeu?

item.title: What's gone wrong for Chelsea in the WSL this season?
item.description: Chelsea have gone from winning an unbeaten domestic treble to falling 12 points adrift of the WSL leaders - so where has it all gone wrong?

item.title: The most powerful woman in football - meet game's first female super agent
item.description: Super agent Rafaela Pimenta looks after some of the biggest names in the game - and has spoken exclusively to the BBC.

item.title: Nine siblings and a dog called Zoomer - Wirtz in his own words
item.description: Florian Wirtz sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his slow start at Anfield, playing padel and making Bundesliga history.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: What do you get for winning EFL Cup?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what the winner of the Carabao Cup gets.

item.title: When is transfer deadline day around the world?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain when the transfer deadline is set around the world.

item.title: How many players are clubs allowed to loan out?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain the rules around how many players clubs are allowed to send out on loan

item.title: What happens during a football medical?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain what is involved in a medical exam when a football player joins a new club.

item.title: What is a transfer deal sheet?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at what a transfer deal sheet is and why it is needed for transfers on deadline day.

item.title: How much do teams earn for reaching Champions League knockouts?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team breaks down how much money Premier League teams have received by advancing to the knockout phase of the competition.

item.title: Which countries haven't had a Premier League player?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore which countries have not been represented in the Premier League.

item.title: Late Maswanhise bids rejected - Wednesday's gossip
item.description: Jens Berthel Askou confirms Motherwell dismissed late deadline-day interest in Tawanda Maswanhise, who had been interesting Celtic.

item.title: Why did Celtic turn down £25m bid for Engels?
item.description: Manager Martin O'Neill is delighted Celtic chose to reject Nottingham Forest's big offer for Arne Engels, so what were the factors at play behind the deadline day decision?

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: Why are Paris St-Germain struggling to hit top form?
item.description: European champions PSG face Newcastle in the Champions League on Wednesday - but why have Luis Enrique's side not been at their best so far this term?

item.title: Bayern legend? How Kane is viewed in Germany as contract talks begin
item.description: Harry Kane is entering the final 18 months of his Bayern Munich contract, and the German champions are eager to keep the prolific striker, as German football writer Constantin Eckner explains.

item.title: Atalanta's Lookman set to join Atletico Madrid
item.description: Ademola Lookman is set to join Atletico Madrid from Atalanta for 35m euros (£30.3m) with the 28-year-old forward due to travel to Spain to undergo a medical.

item.title: Arsenal sign goalkeeper Votikova on loan
item.description: Arsenal have signed goalkeeper Barbora Votikova on loan for the rest of the 2025-26 season from Slavia Prague.

item.title: Quiz: Name 10 most expensive signings by WSL sides
item.description: The WSL transfer window shuts soon, so why not test your knowledge by naming the league's top 10 most expensive signings?

item.title: Cages, crushes and stabbings - is European away safety getting worse?
item.description: BBC Sport explores the safety issues fans face when following their team across Europe.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.
